newsitem.title: CAMEROON: Cholera kills 100 people in north Cameroon.
newsitem.headline: Cholera kills 100 people in north Cameroon.

text.p: Cholera, an annual rainy season scourge in the Central African state of Cameroon, has killed 100 people in the north near the border with Chad so far this year, medical workers in the region said on Saturday.

The outbreak, which is concentrated in the regions of Maga, Yagoua and Kousseri, had infected a further 400 people, they added. Cholera killed 500 people in Cameroon last year, mostly in the same area.
